intro: Cyathea paisa, commonly known as the Páis tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant exhibits a unique growth pattern, with its roots forming a dense, fibrous mat that helps anchor it in moist, shaded environments. Cyathea paisa typically thrives in humid, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in rainforest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological diversity in its native habitat.
